tool.name: coords2clnt.py
tool.description:
Given coordinates of the aligned reads, calculate positions of the crosslinked nucleotides. Crosslinked nts are assumed to be one nt upstream of the 5'-end of the read.
By default output is written to stdout.
Input: * bed6 file containing coordinates of aligned reads * bed6 file containing coordinates of crosslinking events
Example usage: - convert read coordinates from file in.bed to coordinates of the crosslinking events, written to out.bed: coords2clnt.py in.bed --outfile out.bed
tool.command:
coords2clnt.py #if $positional_1 and $positional_1 is not None: $positional_1 #end if
#if $outfile and $outfile is not None: --outfile $outfile #end if $verbose $debug > $default
